question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [IsBurnable Exploitation] At line 28, if input.IsBurnable is set to false, but the attacker later gains control, could they bypass burn restrictions? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [TokenName Injection] At line 30, input.ProtocolName is passed directly to TokenName - does this validate against malicious strings, HTML/SQL injection, or extremely long names? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Protocol Name Collision] Can two different NFT protocols have identical ProtocolNames at line 30, causing confusion or phishing attacks? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Metadata Injection] At line 21, GetTokenExternalInfo(input) processes user metadata - could malicious metadata keys/values corrupt the ExternalInfo structure? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Reserved Key Bypass] Does GetTokenExternalInfo() at line 21 properly prevent users from overwriting reserved keys like NftTypeMetadataKey, NftBaseUriMetadataKey? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [BaseUri Validation] Is input.BaseUri validated for proper URI format, length limits, and malicious content before being stored at line 21? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [BaseUri Manipulation] Could an attacker provide a BaseUri pointing to malicious content or infinite redirects, causing issues for NFT resolvers? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [IsTokenIdReuse Exploitation] If input.IsTokenIdReuse is true, does this allow attackers to reuse burned token IDs in ways that violate uniqueness assumptions? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Metadata Size DOS] Can an attacker provide extremely large metadata dictionaries in input.Metadata causing storage exhaustion and high gas costs? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Reentrancy] At line 34, State.TokenContract.Create.Send() is an external call - could a malicious TokenContract reenter Create() before line 38 updates MinterListMap? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [External Call Failure] If State.TokenContract.Create.Send() at line 34 reverts, does Create() properly rollback all state changes or leave partial state? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Symbol Reuse Attack] If TokenContract.Create() fails at line 34, is the generated symbol at line 20 marked as used in IsCreatedMap, preventing reuse? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Token Creation Race] Between lines 34 and 38, if the TokenContract successfully creates the token but this contract fails, could the token exist without an NFT protocol? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Issuer Mismatch] Does TokenContract.Create() at line 34 verify that the issuer matches the creator, or could there be a mismatch between token issuer and NFT creator? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Cross-Contract State Inconsistency] If TokenContract state updates at line 34 but NFTContract state updates at lines 38, 53 fail, could the contracts be in inconsistent states? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Minter Authorization] At lines 36-38, if input.MinterList is null, a new list is created, but are there checks that creator can actually grant minting permissions? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Minter List Bypass] At line 37, if creator is not in the minterList, it's added, but could an attacker exploit this to add unauthorized addresses? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Minter List Duplication] Does line 37 check for duplicate addresses before adding creator to minterList, or could duplicates cause iteration issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Minter List Size DOS] Can an attacker provide input.MinterList with thousands of addresses at line 36, causing gas exhaustion when storing at line 38? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Minter Address Validation] Are addresses in input.MinterList validated to be non-zero and properly formatted before storage at line 38? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Minter List Overwrite] At line 38, State.MinterListMap[symbol] directly overwrites - could this conflict with existing data if symbol collision occurs? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Creator Removal Attack] Since creator is added at line 37 after checking if minterList contains it, could a malicious input.MinterList exclude the creator initially? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Protocol Info Overwrite] At line 53, State.NftProtocolMap[symbol] stores the protocol - is there a check to prevent overwriting existing protocols with same symbol? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Metadata Inconsistency] At line 46, protocolInfo.Metadata copies from tokenExternalInfo, but could modifications to tokenExternalInfo after line 21 cause inconsistency? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [BaseUri Override] At line 43, protocolInfo.BaseUri is set from input.BaseUri, but is this the same value stored in tokenExternalInfo at line 21? (Low)
